g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute
: based on the understanding that the constellation of relevant actors
and institutions will vary across industrial sectors, with each sector operating under a different
technological regime and under different competitiv
e or market conditions. A sectoral innovation, thus,
can be defined as “that system (group) of firms active in developing and making a sector's products and
in generating and utilising a sector's technologies”
Regional and Global innovation systems (RIS, GIS)
, recognising that the many innovation processes
have a spatial dimension, where the development of system resources such as knowledge, market
nd technology legitimacy may well draw on actors, networks, and
. In other cases, the distribution of many innovation
processes are highly internationalised and therefore outside specific t
between an industry’s dominant innovation mode... and the economic system of valuation in which
markets for the innovation are constructed.”
whose relevance comes into focus with the move towards
oriented programs as part of the increasing innovation policy efforts to address societal
challenges. Accordingly, an MIS is seen as consisting of “networks of agen
that contribute to the development and diffusion of innovative solutions with the aim to define, pursue
Notably the innovation systems approach has been us
ed in a number of climate
(Echeverría 1998; Klerkx et al. 2012; Horton and Mackay 2003;
(Sagar and Holdren 2002; OECD 2006; Gallagher et al. 2012; Wieczorek et al. 2013;
Mignon and Bergek 2016; Darmani et al. 2014)
(Clark et al. 2016; Bryden and Gezelius 2017; Anadon et al.
A number of functions can be used to understand and characterise the performance of technological
. The most common functions are in Table
Functions that the literature identified as key for well
knowledge and/or market opportunities into real
Knowledge diffusion through networks, both among members of a
community (e.g., scientific researchers) and across communities
directs the investments in innovation in
consonance with signals from the market, firms or government
Market formation through customers or government policy is
o allow new technologies to compete with incumbent
